meanings.definition: The end or extremity of anything.
meanings.sent1: She sat on the butts of the bench.
meanings.sent2: The dog wagged its tail with excitement, hitting people with its butts.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel stored nuts in the butts of the tree.
meanings.sent4: The sun dipped below the horizon, painting the sky in shades of orange and pink like the butts of a rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The detective followed the trail of clues, leading him to the butts of the mystery.

meanings.sent1: He flicked the butts of his cigarette onto the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The smoker carefully extinguished the butts of his cigarette in the ashtray.
meanings.sent3: The teacher found butts of cigarettes in the school's parking lot.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were littered with the butts of cigarettes, a sign of careless behavior.
meanings.sent5: The wind carried the scent of stale butts of cigarettes through the air.

meanings.definition: To strike or push with the head or horns.
meanings.sent1: The goat butts the fence when it wants attention.
meanings.sent2: The ram butts its rival during mating season.
meanings.sent3: The toddler playfully butts his head against his father's chest.
meanings.sent4: The boxer butts his opponent in the ring, trying to gain an advantage.
meanings.sent5: The bull butts the gate, eager to be released into the field.
